title: Which is More Random?
question_text:
Two Students, Aisha and Mariam, were having a discussion about randomness in their AP Statistics class. They wondered about the fairness of a two-sided coin. To investigate, they decided to flip the coin four times.
Which of the following is the most likely to happen in four independent trials of flipping a two-sided coin?

distractor_explanations.A: Choice 'A' is incorrect. Since all events have the same probability, no choice is more likely than the others to happen.
distractor_explanations.B: Choice 'B' is incorrect. Since all events have the same probability, no choice is more likely than the others to happen.
distractor_explanations.C: Choice 'C' is incorrect. Since all events have the same probability, no choice is more likely than the others to happen.
distractor_explanations.D: Choice 'D' is incorrect. Since all events have the same probability, no choice is more likely than the others to happen.
